<!-- {{! Do not edit this file directly. This is generated by the `generate-settings-readme` npm script }} -->

The following are the default values of the settings provided by the Ansible
Language Server:

  - **ansible.ansible.path**:
  Path to the ansible executable<br />
  *default value: `ansible`*

  - **ansible.ansible.useFullyQualifiedCollectionNames**:
  Toggle usage of fully qualified collection names (FQCN) when inserting module names<br />
  *default value: `true`*

  - **ansible.ansibleLint.enabled**:
  Toggle usage of ansible-lint<br />
  *default value: `true`*

  - **ansible.ansibleLint.path**:
  Path to the ansible-lint executable<br />
  *default value: `ansible-lint`*

  - **ansible.ansibleLint.arguments**:
  Optional command line arguments to be appended to ansible-lint invocation<br />
  *default value: ``*

  - **ansible.python.interpreterPath**:
  Path to the python/python3 executable. This settings may be used to make the extension work with ansible and ansible-lint installations in a python virtual environment<br />
  *default value: ``*

  - **ansible.python.activationScript**:
  Path to a custom activation script, which is to be used instead of te settings above to run in a python virtual environment<br />
  *default value: ``*

  - **ansible.executionEnvironment.containerEngine**:
  Container engine to be used while running with execution environment. valid values are &#x60;auto&#x60;, &#x60;podman&#x60; and &#x60;docker&#x60;. For &#x60;auto&#x60;, it will look for podman and then for docker<br />
  *default value: `auto`*

  - **ansible.executionEnvironment.enabled**:
  Toggle usage of an execution environment<br />
  *default value: `false`*

  - **ansible.executionEnvironment.image**:
  Name of the execution environment to be used<br />
  *default value: `quay.io/ansible/creator-ee:latest`*

  - **ansible.executionEnvironment.pullPolicy**:
  Image pull policy to be used. Valid values are &#x60;always&#x60;, &#x60;missing&#x60;, &#x60;never&#x60; and &#x60;tag&#x60;. always will always pull the image when extension is activated or reloaded. &#x60;missing&#x60; will pull if not locally available. &#x60;never&#x60; will never pull the image and &#x60;tag&#x60; will always pull if the image tag is &#x27;latest&#x27;, otherwise pull if not locally available.<br />
  *default value: `missing`*
